schema:name: Percentage of the total population in England living in close proximity of greenspace, 2020 to 2024

schema:creator.schema:name: Department for Environment, Food & Rural Affairs

schema:isBasedOn.schema:name: Percentage of the total population in England with access to nearby green space

schema:variableMeasured: The percentage of the total population in England with access to nearby green space
notes:
Figure G3a covers both urban and rural areas.
    
</br>Doorstep Greenspace is accessible greenspace of at least 0.5 hectares in size within a 200 metre straight-line distance from home; Local Natural Greenspace is accessible natural greenspace of at least 2 hectares in size within a 300 metre straight-line distance from home; and Neighbourhood Natural Greenspace is accessible natural greenspace of at least 10 hectares within a 1 kilometre (km) straight-line distance from home.

</br>The Combined Greenspace category, while not an officially designated greenspace standard in itself, includes the percentage of the population living within the defined proximity of access to any one or more of the Doorstep Greenspace, and Local and Neighbourhood Natural Greenspace Standards outlined above. 

</br>The ‘percentage of total population covered by greenspace buffer’ is based on an assumption that the population within each [lower layer super output area](https://www.ons.gov.uk/methodology/geography/ukgeographies/censusgeography#super-output-area-soa) (LSOA) is evenly distributed.

columns.name: year
columns.schema:description: The year range for the data present

datatype.format: Combined Greenspace|Neighbourhood Natural Greenspace|Local Natural Greenspace|Doorstep Greenspace

columns.name: value
columns.schema:description: The percentage of the total population in England with access to nearby green space
